title: If you choose to ignore danger pings or messages it is YOUR problem for whatever happens.
body:

Bingo.  Half the time a spam ping is from someone back in the base that thinks they own the particular lane and they're mad you're taking farm that they wouldn't be getting anyway.

Just as when I'm ulting to my lane on top of a huge minion wave as Pantheon and the midlaner spams for me to back off, because they want that farm.

But it's not even that.

When somebody spams "_Back off_" ping on top of you, it gives you exactly zero information, while only distracting you.

Like at least ping in the fucking direction of the danger I'm suppose to run away from.

Actually the back off ping does give info. It tells you to back off. more specifically it tells you that there is someone coming for you. which means it's time for you to be on guard, and watch yourself. head to a direction where you have space from most threats and head to whatever the nearest ally is, tower or champion. if you're in a safe position already, you can risk to ignore it, especially if it comes from a champion that is known to attract unsavory players that care too much for farm.

Let me paint a picture with words.
You are pushing bot lane, and you are a bit overextended. you figure you should be fine because there was recently a four v four fight in midlane. someone pings for you to back off. first thing you ought to do is step out of obvious vision and check your map. if you see that there are enemies missing, you should hug the bottom wall and go towards your team's tower, or the center brush, and attempt to back. If you stay where you are and farm ignoring it you are going to die from the inevitable collapse. if you attempt to walk to a safe spot and there isn't anything close enough, there is a good chance you will be cut off.

But, the most important thing is that you listen to the ping and play around the information. sometimes nothing happens. but you need to plan for the worst case.

It is hard to click on enemies, especially if they are missing in the fog of war but you know they are heading somewhere.

This is particularly true in higher elos where no roamers will walk through commonly warded places, and you can't just ward where you think they'll walk because it'll be deep in the enemy jungle.

Also: If the enemy has a TF or Shen DON'T FIGHT IF YOU CAN'T WIN A 3 OR 4 v 2. I can't tell you how many times I've destroyed a TF in lane only to have him farm my supp/adc every ~120 seconds.

Oh also if you die to their mid don't automatically start spamming me to take turret. I know that's the ideal move. But if I'm low on mana and they have a jungler that can kill me before I get back to tower, I'm not gonna risk it. Especially if I don't have flash. I mean, I know your game knowledge is pretty low (thus your death) but this is basic stuff.
